Test: Explains the rules of escape characters used for templates and placeholders
message: In template messages '\' is used as an escape character. Since double quote (i.e. ") is used start and end JSON string values, to obtain an output containing a double quote requires an escaped double quote in the template message (i.e. \"). Additionally you may use two backslashes to escape the opening tag for a placeholder to print the literal placeholder string (e.g. \\\${placeholder} => \${placeholder})
